website_summaries.verdict: If you need a toy that will do its part to help your dog’s oral health while holding strong against the most dedicated chewers, this is the blue gorilla you’ve been looking for.
pros: Infused with baking soda to promote dental health

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Durabilty for a kitty Cat
customer_reviews.text: Extreme Durabilty for even the most powerful chewers ,, Pffffffff my puppy had this less than 20 minutes and was already chewing the head off into pieces .
customer_reviews.author: Jilly Jill

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: My dog ripped the head off in 10 minutes. It did not stand up to its claim of durability at all.
customer_reviews.author: Darnell R Schuettler

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Its cute but didn't last long. We have a 90 pound German Shepherd and his teeth cut this cute gorilla in two pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: E and K Tolson

customer_reviews.title: Longest Lasting $8 Toy I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: My heavy chewer needs Kong toys or else they're in pieces very quickly. This is one of the few toys I can give for 10+ minutes and it's still intact. I take it away after 20 minutes to extend the life. Smells great and my dog is entertained by it, so we will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M M

customer_reviews.title: Tough Gorilla, not so tough Gator
customer_reviews.text: Survived over a month with my 9 month old Doberman and Chiweenie. It has lost a little rubber off the top, but not much. My dogs are experts at destroying toys so this one is holding up very well. UPDATE: Blue Gorilla still hanging in there. New Green Gator not so much. Decided to give Gator a try since Gorilla was still going. Well, Gator feet were eaten off immediately. About week later the head is slowly being eaten. On the upside, my Dobermans poop is easy to identify at the dog park. It has flecks of bright green rubber in it. For aggressive chewers stick to the Gorilla.
customer_reviews.author: sun diego

customer_reviews.title: Good for small puppies
customer_reviews.text: My mini dachshund likes it. I soaked it overnight in dish soap to lessen the smell a little bit. Broke up a few “potty” treats and dropped them in so that when it moves around the small pieces fall right out. He likes it and I’m sure it feels good on his little puppy teeth.
customer_reviews.author: CaseyMax22

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: We are training a puppy to be a service dog and one of the rules with her is “no toys that smell like food”. That’s challenging for a teething puppy! This product meets the challenge. She loves gnawing on it in her kennel and it meets the rules for a toy for her. I’m really pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this for aggressive chewers!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this for aggressive chewers!! Our 7 month old Bernedoodle had this for less than 10 minutes and the head was GONE! The rubber is super soft, and easy to take apart. Maybe they’re advertising it’s for aggressive chewers because the toy is very thick, but it was super easy for him to get the head off and eat it...not safe!!
customer_reviews.author: vissersinchina

customer_reviews.title: Her very favorite toy bar none!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! By far my dog's favorite! It dispenses small treats like her kibble very slowly so the fun lasts a very long time. She is a 4 year old collie who happily destroys any toy including most of the ones labeled as for aggressive chewers. Not this one! She gnaws and tosses and gnaws some more and since a treat is randomly dispensed every once in a while, this continues sometimes for hours! Great play and exercise. Best toy ever! And she loves it dearly! Am ordering another as a backup!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pam N

customer_reviews.title: Great for chewers!
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape, made it easy for my dog to grip and bite down @ different angles. Has lasted longer than other rubber chew toys we have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Jegray

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, aggressive chewers will definitely NOT tear this up quickly! It actually smells good, and, in accordance with its claim to freshen breath, it does. Puppy breath is anything but sweet...after playing with this, it's much, much better. It's heavy, so you need to be careful around windows, etc....but, it bounces so rolling it is great, as it jolts sideways, and gives your pup a good work out! Will buy this again, and again! First toy I've found that will outlast a pups energy....and chewing!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: great toy SO FAR for my aggressive chewer
customer_reviews.text: so i have a HUGE lab retriever who is a very VERY aggressive chewer. he chews thru mostly everything. even the strongest Kong product. we got the Gorilla, and it smells great due to the baking soda and he LOVES it!!! we have had it for 2 weeks and it hasn't broken it yet. which means alot since normally its broken within the first hour. he focuses on the weak spots to destroy any toy. it has a hole on the bottom for treats. i got the biggest size and my dog is 70 lbs. *** Update we have had it for over 2 months and it's still going strong ***
customer_reviews.author: Miss Jenny Russo

customer_reviews.title: Gorilla - Destroyed my dogs bad breath!
customer_reviews.text: This gorilla toy has been great for our household. It has a small hole in the bottom for treats which I had to cut a couple of the tabs off. It was too hard to get treats out. The dogs love it (I have 2 small breed dogs) and I love that their breath is pleasant after chewing on this toy for a few minutes. I was afraid that this was going to be too big for them to lug around, but it hasn't stopped them. I would like it if there was a smaller one available for different breed dogs. I would highly recommend the Gorilla product.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney C.

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable, Didn’t Last 5 Minutes!
customer_reviews.text: ‘Made from extremely durable, all natural rubber to withstand even the most aggressive of chewers. While no dog toy is truly indestructible, this one comes very close.’ The above quote was what convinced me to buy this toy for my dog - within 5 minutes pieces of this ‘extremely durable’ toy were chewed-off. Bad idea thinking this toy would be a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Lainee

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs hate these items
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these items one each for my two Golden Retrievers. Only to help with their teeth cleanig. The product would be perfect if it DIDN'T HAVE A TERRIBLE PLASTIC CHEMICAL SMELL. My dogs won't go near them. Do not buy these. My wife contacted the manufacturer and never received a response. We wasted our money on this trash
customer_reviews.author: Charles Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Rated for up to 35 lbs
customer_reviews.text: All of the reviews knocking it for not withstanding a 90 lb dog for long... the package specifically states that it is rated for up 35 lb dogs. Bought two toys to gift to my sister’s dogs. When I saw the 35 lb rating I gifted this to the Manchester Terrier that rips through most everything almost immediately; three hours later he was still chewing with not a piece ripped off. Even shared it for a bit with the Rottweiler with no damage. We are always pleasantly surprised with toys that make it more than 15-30 minutes. For whatever reason, he spent a lot of time licking this in addition to chewing. Very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brogger

customer_reviews.title: The Sole Surviving Dog Toy
customer_reviews.text: This blue monkey is tough as a car tire. Our cattle dog Stella has chewed on it for 10 months and there's no damage. Stella brings it to us inside the house, we toss it away, and it's got an unexpected bounce (due to the irregular shape) that makes it fun to chase. It's not gooey or stinky. I did try the kibble inside early on, but there's no way for a dog (or a human) to get it out, so, I don't use that feature. Three blue monkeys came in the package so there's always one handy. Great value. You won't go wrong with the blue monkey if you've got an aggressive chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: A good product for the right dog
customer_reviews.text: I got the Magilla Gorilla chew toy for my Lab. He didn't give it a second look after the first smell. Not that it smelled bad, or that anything was wrong with it. In fact it seemed well made, of durable material, and would probably be a grew dental appliance for the right minded dog. Mine just didn't care for it, even with treats inside. I'll give it to a friend with another large dog. See how he likes it. I gave it three stars because for my dog it wasn't good, but I can't say it was bad nor speak to it's effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: washushae

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps ok for medium chewers
customer_reviews.text: Was advertised for aggressive chewers when purchased (now just heavy chewers) and an Amazon Choice for "indestructible dog toys" , but sadly isn't. Our dog REALLY liked this gorilla, and while he loves chewing I wouldn't call him a strong chewer . Still he managed to chew of a foot and the head relatively fast as these seems to be the weak point. I think it would last if Arm & Hammer had provide same material as a ball.
customer_reviews.author: CFo

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR TOY DEMOLITIONERS. EXTREMELY DURABLE.
customer_reviews.text: This is EXTREMELY durable. Might even be TOO durable. Its deffinetly for LARGE dogs. I have a 1/2 lab, 1/4 Aussie, 1/4 Border Collie, he weighs about 68lbs. Its almost too big/heavy for him and difficult for him to get treats out, but he still likes playing with it! I'd deffinetly reccomend for bigger stronger breeds like Rottweilers, Pits, German Shepherds, Belgian Malinois, Great Danes, ect. Even the most Destructive freakishly strong dog I know (who has litterally destroyed every toy it comes into contact with, even the SOLID HARD plastic bones) didnt make a dent in this.
customer_reviews.author: ismile

customer_reviews.title: Seems durable
customer_reviews.text: Well, I wasn’t sure about this toy because our dog loves squeaky toys, and shredding stuffing. But, I put a bit of his kibble in it and he’s been going nuts! It usually takes him about 5 minutes even for the toughest toys. This one has lasted 30 min and it’s still going. I also like it because the grooves make it nice to put peanut butter in so he can lick also. He loves it. And, not sure if it’s helping his teeth, but it can’t hurt. I’ll update if it’s breaks!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Longest lasting toy for our AmStaff!
customer_reviews.text: This is the longest lasting dog chew toy we’ve had so far! We have a young amstaff and he loves to chew his toys and stuffies into shreds. Other dogs chew toys are made of such hard and strange material that he’s cut his gums up, ouch, poor baby. But this toy is made of a really thick durable rubber. I mean, he’s definitely chewing it up and eating some of it, but it’s lasting SO long! He loves it. And it’s bouncy so it’s an excellent toy to play with as well.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but hole for treats is WAY too small
customer_reviews.text: My dog tried to play with it but the hole the treats go in was way too hard - I can't even get them out. I saw someone said to cut away the flaps, but nothing really works unless my fingers are in danger of being sliced. I tried her favorite treats, kibble, peanut butter (smeared inside and outside) and nothing really got her interested. Great concept but the hole is WAY too small (even if the flaps were chopped off). This was a waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Becca R

customer_reviews.title: It has such an amazing smell even after weeks of chewing
customer_reviews.text: I just adopted and rescued a female red nose pittbull and she goes thru a stuffy in less than 20 minutes. The eyes are gone instantly and the squeaky part and stuffing are spread throughout my house within 20 minutes but this gorilla has no head but after weeks she is still going at it. Plus it has the best smell ever. Even after all the slobber it smells amazing. I Instantly recalled this smell from childhood but no idea what it is
customer_reviews.author: Daisymommy

customer_reviews.title: Only truly indestructible dog toy I’ve found !
customer_reviews.text: I just rescued a 3 year old boxer who I took from a very bad situation. He’s been very nervous and confused with the transition. Every other toy I bought him he either shredded immediately or ignored the toy but enjoyed the packaging. Then Gorilla came! First smile I saw from my new boy was around Gorilla. Now he always knows where his Gorilla is in case he needs to have a good chew! smells good and so far no pieces have come off For me to step on.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn M Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Seriously GREAT buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 85lb young (read very playful and needs attention/stimulation) Mastiff. I love buying her toys but they are usually in shreds in anywhere from 2 to 10mins and her fun is over. It gets costly. This toy thrilled her and it has survived her massive love (read huge ass jaw. Lol) Seeing her knock him around and do her best at destruction made this my new favorite as well. Worth the $ and then some!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Obnoxious Strong Smell!
customer_reviews.text: It's not worth the money. Currently out in the garage. The plastic/rubber smell is SO strong it was literally giving me a headache. Is it worth the money and hassle to return? Probably not. Will just take to local Humane Society where unfortunately they aren't/can't be as picky as me. And from Arm & Hammer? Such a name brand! Shame of them is all I can say!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Write

customer_reviews.title: My destroys every toy, NOT this one
customer_reviews.text: I'm always very skeptical of any review that states a toy is indestructible, but I still keep buying them with the hopes that one will finally come through. This toy makes the cut. I have found others that my dog didn't destroy, but those have been due to his losing interest. This is the first toy he hasn't even chewed a corner off of, and he keeps playing with it. Must be something to do with the texture of the toy, or the treat hole that I've been able to put a treat in, but he can't get it out.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shuman

customer_reviews.title: Giant teeth and no wear at all yet!
customer_reviews.text: One dog loves it. One dog doesn't. So..They don't fight over it! The dog who chews it hasn't made a dent in it and she's a 110 lb akita/anatolian/something/something mix. Only negative: We put biscuits in it, no one can get them out. No one. But I smear the nubby areas with her dog tooth paste and she chews it. Her sister doesn't care for it, she prefers tv remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Lamphere

customer_reviews.title: Strong and cheap. Two pit bulls have not destroyed it in over a month.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and strong. Two pit bulls have worked this thing over daily for over a month and it still exists. That's saying a lot. It is kinda like a Kong with a hole to stuff treats and peanut butter in, etc. In this case you shove the treats up the gorilla's backside. Unfortunately, the ape hole is a little tight, so once a milk bone is past the monkey hole, it may never come out.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew David

customer_reviews.title: Smells chemical-y
customer_reviews.text: It smells terrible, and seems to taste terrible for my dog. She chewed it for a few mi it’s, got some water, and hasn’t touched it since - it’s been in the same spot on the office floor for weeks now. Would return if I could
customer_reviews.author: V. laney

customer_reviews.title: Giant Schnauzer APPROVED
customer_reviews.text: We have a very active 3 year old female Giant Schnauzer (74 pounds), she is a toy destroyer! This thing has lasted over a month and is still going strong! Outside of the KONG Extreme chew toys and maybe a tree stump she manages to destroy everything within a day or 2 if not sooner, so for the price I highly recommend this Super Treadz Gorilla. My only question to Arm& Hammer and their dog toy division is why aren't there more tough toy variations like the Gorilla?
customer_reviews.author: Rohb Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. I will mention, only put kibble in this toy, like dry dog food. Anything larger than that gets super stuck, nearly impossible for even humans to get out. I used pliers to get lodged larger treats out if youre reading this after getting treats stuck inside. Dog likes it only if theres kibble in it.
customer_reviews.author: Danica

customer_reviews.title: Dog's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: In the first 30 mins my dog managed to chew off part of the head and hand, BUT she hasn't chewed off any part since. Now that she knows she can get treats from the toy, every half hour or so, she will go and pick it up and drop it and carry it all throughout the house for treats! She plays with it for at least an hour or 2 a day. We ended up cutting off one of the triangles on the bottom so that treats could come out, otherwise they would stay stuck inside.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: For a softer toy, this held up well!
customer_reviews.text: This toy has held up surprisingly well. Usually my dog (8yo bully mix) destroys anything that’s not hard plastic, but 20 minutes in, she didn’t have any chunks bitten off! She did eventually chew off some pieces, but it’s still “alive”. For an aggressive chewer, I call this a win, especially if your dog has slowed down the pace of their chewing, but you still need something hardy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: This one’s pretty great. My dog likes to grind her toys into mulch and pretty much everything not rated for extreme chewing is toast in under 30 min. This one’s lasted well over a month. She mauled the top of it’s face off but that seems to be the only part she’s able to get. Which is surprising as it’s not hard plastic. We don’t usually fill it with treats as she’s more into the chewing. But it does hold them. But you have to chuck it at a wall to get them back out.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Started falling apart less than an hour. 4 month puppy
customer_reviews.text: It smelled great! We were so excited about the new toy for our doggo. Our 4th month old 27 pound Lab X Husky mix played with it for 40 minutes and immediately I noticed the green rubber falling off. Took it away from her and gave her back her old Kong. No doubt if I let her have it over night she could’ve consumed the thing. Returned the item. It did help get some of her troublesome baby tooth out, so that was a place.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Puppy LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t even have to put treats in it. My Pup is an aggressive chewer... And, Yes. The Ape can be chewed and it comes off in little nubs. But she doesn’t swallow them so no worries there. A word to the wise though. Don’t fall asleep with this ape around where your Pup can get ahold of it. It’s Heavy and could cause serious injury when dropped unexpectedly on your head! Hahahahahahahahaha! A plus is that her Breath is Refreshingly Pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: ImaJewelaholic

customer_reviews.title: My 90 lb destructive mutt loves this.
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this gorilla. He typically destroys just about everything he can fit in his mouth, but this thing just wont budge. He hasn’t even put a dent in it. Literally, it’s still fully intact. His teeth have already shown improvement and he’s only had this toy for 1/2 months now. This is one of his go-to toys, and i’ve even caught him snuggling it in his sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great teething and cure for boredom
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a great teething toy or a toy for to keep a dog busy! My puppy was chewing on EVERYTHING she has other toys but this toy has been perfect for her and its only been a day and she wont leave it alone yay!!! My puppy is a 5month old Doberman and even my 7 year old Doberman loves it to so now i have to buy another one already! On the bottom of the Gorilla it has a place you can put a treat inside and i think its great! Ill do an update of anything changes but I believe this toy is going to be her best friend!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Vares

customer_reviews.title: Dog And Owner Approved! Smells Nice!
customer_reviews.text: My little angel (Newfoundland) loves her gorilla toy! It smells so good and even when you play with them your hands smell like baby powder instead of rubber or drool lol. She’s always walking around with it in her mouth and chewing on it more than her other toys so I’m glad she’s enjoying it. She usually tears up every toy in two seconds but this held up like the XL Breed Kong Toys we have.
customer_reviews.author: Bassbro

customer_reviews.title: Smells AWFUL!
customer_reviews.text: This toy smelled awful right out of the Amazon box! It's a plastic, weird scent. My puppy wouldn't go near it! The scent was so strong that it filled the room. Yesterday, remembering that the write up said you can put it in the dishwasher, I did so. MISTAKE! Now my dishwasher smells! Because I have always liked the Arm & Hammer brand I gave this product an abundance of time and chance to air out and get better but it only seems worse. Deeply disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a super chewer!
customer_reviews.text: Having a super chewer I need to always have something for her to keep her occupied. If not she is into eating many things like table legs, shoes, tissues, blankets, etc...I bought the gorilla & the gator oh about two months ago, she has eaten the snout and feet of the gator with the gorilla the head, hands, and feet. She loves them as her go to toys and just naw on it squeaking away. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Can't get your treats out :(
customer_reviews.text: The item is so durable its difficult for my lab to get the bone into small enough pieces to fall out the bottom. The whole on the bottom is tiny too. My lab's jaw can break thru almost anything, its his strongest muscles. He loved the toy until the treats never came out after chewing on it for 10 mins. I've had this for months now, the same treat still in it and he won't bother! lol
customer_reviews.author: J. Berg

customer_reviews.title: Better than Kong
customer_reviews.text: I actually have 2 dogs (one 40 lbs and one 12 lbs) and the large dog that usually chews through everything still hasn't destroyed this one at all. He's lost interest in his other sturdy toys but not this one because of the treat incentives inside. However, it's better than Kong because it has the grooves to help with dental hygiene. Based on everyone's reviews it sounds like I was smart to buy the Gorilla one since it's shape allows for it to be harder to destroy than the gator. Overall, it was so worth the money. Also, my little one guards it with his life -- they're best buds now.
customer_reviews.author: KittyC

customer_reviews.title: Chew on this!
customer_reviews.text: Well, my two pups have been chewing on this all day and it’s only lost a few tiny bits. Not perfect, but has outlasted MANY other toys we’ve thrown away money on. If our Aussie-mut had it all to himself, it would probably last forever. His sister, a pit-boxer mix is the more aggressive chewer. Overall, I’m pleased and I think the Aussie’s terrible breath is a little better!
customer_reviews.author: P. Cotman

customer_reviews.title: Tough, fun, holds treats in dogs LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs LOVE this toy! It’s also incredibly sturdy - as sturdy as the sturdiest dog toys we have ever had in decades of dog parenting. Our older dog can destroy almost anything, we have such trouble keeping toys, and she has been working on destroying this with no success! It has nice little grippers that keep treats inside. It also has nice grooves all over it that clean her teeth. I highly recommend this. Fantastic value!!!!
customer_reviews.author: book liker

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy, my dog loves it and seeks it out. My only issue is the hole on the bottom is not large enough. I stuck a treat in it that was probably too small and I had to remove it with tweezers and it took awhile. I will likely just use this as a chew toy and not as an activity/treat dispenser. Seems very solid and I haven't seen any signs of wear yet. I have a Great Dane puppy who is teething if that gives you any idea of the sturdiness of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Ums

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for Super Chewers
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this. I just bought him another one. I'm not really sure how effective the dental part is because I use a water attitude however this toy lasted a lot longer than many others I have purchased for my 80 pound shepherd. I highly recommend it but just watch out cause they can bite off pieces and you have to make sure you monitor them. It bounces too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda F

customer_reviews.title: Not a Favorite but Don't Regret Purchase
customer_reviews.text: My pup is not especially picky with her toys, but she doesn't care for this one at all. She's picked it up maybe once in the past few weeks that we've had it. It has a slightly strange texture and smell (both likely because it's a tooth cleaner), so that may be why she doesn't like it. It's extremely dense and pretty large, so definitely only for big dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell
customer_reviews.text: The toy itself was cute and seemed durable since it's made from hard rubber - but the smell is horrible! I opened the pkg. and the smell hit me immediately so I placed it outside for a few days. I could still smell it but decided to give it to my dog to see what he thought. He took one sniff and walked away.
customer_reviews.author: Life Lover

customer_reviews.title: Not the dimensions listed
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this to be much different because the size listed under "item dimensions" is 8.8 x 17.3 x 8.2 in. Perhaps they meant cm? If you look in the answered questions section it shows it is only 3.5in x 4.75 x 3.75. It worked out ok because my puppy loves it and it has a hole in the bottom for treats or food, so it is great for giving him treats in his crate. It would be nice if they could fix the size in the description though.
customer_reviews.author: AandMP

customer_reviews.title: The answer to easily destroyed dog toys!
customer_reviews.text: Our pitbull can make short work of any toy, so we were astonished when after 3 months this toy was still providing our orally fixated dog tons of satisfaction, while still holding around 75% of its original structure. Also we can tell the buildup of tooth residue is greatly decreased. Our dog is sensitive about mouth and paws and gets anxiety with ritual cleaning procedures of his mouth or paws, so the improvement in his oral health without sacrificing our sanity is really wonderful. Can’t recommend this toy enough!
customer_reviews.author: Domenic Proc

customer_reviews.title: My oversized lap dog destroys all of her toys...except this one!
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the only toy she has yet to decimate! It keeps her entertained for ever! We put her treats in it and she works on it while the kids eat dinner and while I hate the squeaking noises (thank you misophonia) the sanity of not having to kennel or constantly redirect her to not beg helps tremendously!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Smell might be off-putting to some dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my chewy German Shepherd. She won't touch it. I think the smell bothers her, because she LOVES to get a new toy. My 7lb chihuahua has had a great time with it tho. I put some treats in it and he's rolled it all over the house for days trying to get the treats out. He's not had any luck with that, but he's having fun trying!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Good for food oriented pooches!!
customer_reviews.text: This one is well designed and durable!! The opening is slightly recessed. So my girl can't tear the little tabs off, like she's done with others. She's veeeeeeeery food motivated so she spends hours trying to get the treats out! Yay! It may even be too challenging 😜. But, hey it keeps my beagle out of trouble while I'm working... And that's priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Muggs

customer_reviews.title: It has a powerful, horrible smell!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer unscented everything, and I assume my dog also likes unscented toys unless they smell like bacon or some other meat. This smells like an old lady's house and it's so strong that the whole room smells. Cannot handle the smell. I've tried running it through the dishwasher several times - doesn't work. It's not worth sending back because it didn't cost much but the money was wasted.
customer_reviews.author: S. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Dog won’t even pick it up
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates this. He chewed it a few seconds & wont look at it. I even spread pnut butter on it. He licked off the pnut butter and wouldn’t even put it in his mouth afterwards. Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.author: Garden Lady

customer_reviews.title: The large is more medium in size for dogs under 60 lbs
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this more stars if the product were truly "large" rather than a medium size and if the treat hole allowed for treats to fall out. Even the smallest training treats will not come out so they grow hard and stale inside the gorilla. It is definitely durable and sturdy. *Bonus... it retains the wonderful baking soda smell without turning foul after my dog has been chewing and drooling all over it for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Golden Retriever won't touch it
customer_reviews.text: I think this a great concept for a product; however, no matter how many treats or how much peanut butter I put on this my golden retriever hated this product and he chews everything else. I think it may have been the overwhelming smell of baking soda (even after putting it through the dishwasher) on the product. For me it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: DeFrezado

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not indestructible
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. My staffy is a peer chewer so I was excited for this arrive until I saw the reviews about how dogs destroyed it instantly. My staffy took time to “destroy” it because she was weirded out by it as well as the shape and size. She ripped off the tip of the head and the feet but I can still stick treat in it for her to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: Fun Chew toy
customer_reviews.text: My Shiba Inu is a very agressive chewer. I like the smell & it appeals to him. I play tug of war with him & hide it behind my back or in his toy box. My Shiba baby is 18 months old. I think he really enjoys it. I ordered 2 of the alligators, one for him other for the girl Shiba Inu. Since this toy is still in one piece. We keep their toys separate.
customer_reviews.author: Engima

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous toy!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 large dogs and I swear they could chew a tire off a car. Nothing lasts more than a day with them, even toys for aggressive chewers! I tried these toys from Arm and Hammer and they are the bomb. (they make a gorilla and an alligator). My dogs have not managed to tear them up and get hours of enjoyment out of them. I definitely recommend them. Absolutely.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it; great smell; very durable
customer_reviews.text: Oh my dogs love this toy! They can’t get enough & they fight over who gets to chew/play with it. It’s durable, great quality, good for small to medium sized dogs, & it actually smells wonderful. Maybe that’s why they can’t get enough of it. Great purchase & I will try to find more toys similar to this one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Casey B

customer_reviews.title: Great chew toy
customer_reviews.text: I have a Pitbull Weimaraner mix who can literally eat anything. This chew toy has lived far longer than most. After over a month of him burying it, throwing it, and chewing on it, its still alive. Nothing has broken off, when he buries it, I just rinse it off in the sink, it seriously is crazy durable. If your fur baby is a chewer, this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Beccatx02

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Rubber & Money
customer_reviews.text: I guess it’s for huge dogs, my 28lb dog can’t hardly pick it up. It’s too big to chew. You are supposed to put a bully stick in the bottom and it is to entertain your dog...1 second after inserting treat into the bottom my dog pulled it completely out. Complete waste of money! Dog has no interest in it at all. I do not recommend in the least, a big rubber failure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura K

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to say that this toy smells amazing so much that when I got this toy for my dog for Christmas I much didn't want to give it to her because I knew she slobber and dirty it up. Although I am a weaker man so I gave into temptation's and gave her the toy and she absolutely adores it it's tough like an actual silverback gorilla in the wild. Excellent dog toy for the price
customer_reviews.author: James mabus

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOY for "ultra chewers"
customer_reviews.text: We have had this toy for a month. My "ULTRA CHEWER" 1 year old (63 pound) dog can NOT destroy this!! I absolutely love it and so does she. I stuff it with her favorite treats when I leave and she loves trying to get it all out! She only has 4 out of 100 toys Ive gotten her because she chews them all up. This toy has not even been punctured at all and she chews it everyday! It was reccomend by a friend who has two 80 pound German Shepherds.
customer_reviews.author: DEBORAH K SHOCKLEY

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this chew toy 2 days ago, but! So far so good, I have 3 German Shepherds and a heeler. They all love chewing on this toy. (Why I bought 3!) Seems to be holding up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy for Chewers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try to get our dog to chew and clean his teeth/massage his gums. This is a fun looking toy but he's not having it. It is VERY heavy and there is no real place for him to grab onto it and carry it around. I'm going to try adding some doggie toothpaste onto it to lure him but TBD. I'm not disappointed I purchased it. It's trial and error!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible taste/smell
customer_reviews.text: This toy smells weird and my dog does not like it and he loves toys. He doesn't like the taste and won't even grab it in his mouth. I even tried washing it but that did nothing. It got on my fingers and not to be gross but I ended up tasting it on accident and it tastes absolutely horrible. It has a rubber latex taste/smell. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Harris

customer_reviews.title: Tough like a kong, but softer and more textured
customer_reviews.text: This material seems like it will be as durable as the kong toys, but the extra texture and some softer ridges seem like they will massage the gums better, but its just a guess. Unlike kong, the hole in the bottom for treats is unusably small - even little bits of kibble are now stuck in there forever or until I want to take the time to soak them out with water.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Winsome

customer_reviews.title: BEST fetch toy ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for the dog who can't get enough "play fetch' time. Best thing about the gorilla is, the dog doesn't know which way the toy will bounce so he never gets bored. This toy is great for the owner with shoulder problems because you just have to hit the ground with gorilla & the toy does most of the work. Not for most indoor use, unless there's nothing to break in the room. if you've that, then this toy will keep your dog happy regardless of weather outside
customer_reviews.author: Cartooned Desings

customer_reviews.title: Murphy Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Our Goldendoodle is an aggressive chewer and we are always looking for tough toys that he finds entertaining and will hold up. This is one such toy. As tough as a Kong, but smells much better, the shape is fun for him. With a greenie in the aft section, the baking soda and the greenie keeps his teeth clean and his breath fresh. Murphy says buy this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: unknown
customer_reviews.text: My husky and German shorthair have no interest in this toy...I bought it thinking it would be a good chew toy and they don't want anything to do with it...I actually bought 2...I cant review any of the above because I have no idea...no incentive for the dog to chew it..i don't think they even like the way it smells
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my lab to keep his teeth in shape and curb his chewing of plush toys. First, it's rather weighty, so I appreciated that he can't shred it. Second, it has a hollow body to store treats in for some play time as well. Lastly, I put a little peanut butter on it, and he will chew on it forever. It is easily washed with soap and water, and he's yet to be able to even make it look like it's been chewed on.
customer_reviews.author: Just the Facts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Pit Bulls or any other strong chewers!
customer_reviews.text: The gorilla is excellent! My Pit bull, Bella, is a very strong chewer. I was a little hesitant to buy this at first because the only toys durable enough for her have been Kongs. I decided to try it because she needed something for her stinky breath and this got very good reviews. She has had this for over a week, chewing it constantly, and has barely made a dent! Also, her breath is much fresher! I will definitely buy this again when she wears it out but it’s looking like that will be a while from now. Yay! I never do reviews but this toy has been perfect for Bella “Chewer Extraordinaire”!:)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Why Turquoise, Gorilla, Yet My Rylee Loved it?
customer_reviews.text: My Rylee, at 65 lbs pit loved chewing the hell out of this oddly colored, gorilla,....dog chew toy? I can fathom why they chose to make a turquoise gorilla, but she liked it quite a bit. Found at least 4 or 5 times, where I discovered pieces of the toy in her droppings? So I guess its somewhat safe?
customer_reviews.author: YucaipaDan

customer_reviews.title: My dog is completely disinterested, grandpup too
customer_reviews.text: I bought based on the number of people saying it was a favorite, but my dog had zero interest in it. Gave it to my grandpup and he had no interest in it. Even had food inside, they lost interest in that in a couple minutes. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Page

customer_reviews.title: Tough chewer approved!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy for my pup. Shes a really tough chewer and has had this toy for about a month now with not even the slightest dent in it! She hasn’t even been able to get the treats out yet!! Although the weird shape to get a good bite in makes it only her second favorite toy, the arm n hammer quality actually make this toy smell SO GOOD. Would recommend for all dog parents I think you’ll love it !!
customer_reviews.author: Stefani Melendez

customer_reviews.title: My dog LOVES this toy!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is an aggressive chewer. He can tear a toy up in 10 minutes. While he was able to put holes in this toy he didn’t destroy it yet. He loves this toy and plays with it for hours. He likes it, because it bounces. I can put treats in it. I also spread peanut butter on it. He loves it so much that I bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: TangerineSkies2005

customer_reviews.title: Treats don't come out easily enough
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a treat hound. This toy, though, holds little interest for her. It has a strong rubber smell that may be part of the problem. But she did try pretty hard to get the treats out. The design just doesn't work and neither she nor I can get the treats (kibbles) out with much success.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Vestal

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: I had long since given up on any dog toys that my 90 lb lab could not wreck. Wrong! This thing is tough yet soft and resilient, so they love to chew it to death and it remains perfect. But even better - when you throw it outdoors it bounces in the most amazing, irregular and exciting ways - they adore it. Thanks to whoever designed this!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Suzo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for heavy chewers!!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are VERY heavy chewers. They can and have destroyed so many toys marketed for “heavy chewers.” But not this one. As much as they try, the gorilla wont die! The bonus is that it has a fresh fragrance that seems to have improved my dogs breath. Great product! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Coglianese

customer_reviews.title: If you are buying it because it says it’s for aggressive chewers... it’s not.
customer_reviews.text: My dog had it for about 30 seconds before it was destroyed. Not durable at all. He is a bit of an aggressive chewer, but anything rubber that is made well and actually made for aggressive chewers will last with him. He’s had a rubber tire for two years that still survives. This was definitely not made for an aggressive chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Messner

customer_reviews.title: Happy destructive chewers. Toy still in tact!
customer_reviews.text: Our large Aussie pup (8 months now) just loves this. If he is bored or just needs to chew he turns to this with regularity. After a month it is still like new. We had a boxer/pit mix friend over recently who usually destroys toys like this inside of an hour. She did chew it and gave up after 30 minutes so I feel this is a success for those tough destructible chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Karma68

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: It looks cute but it smells weird and my dog won’t go near it. The spokes and holes placed at the bottom (to insert treats) are so thick and sturdy that there’s no way a dog could fish out a treat unless it’s completely ripped apart, we have a pit and it seems that she would have trouble with it even if she was interested.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Cute design but dog doesn’t like it
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cute design toy, but it has a strong smell. Smell like rubber mixed with baking soda and my dog lost interest after few sniff. The size of this is bigger than I expected and heavier than most “large” size rubber chew toys out there. It also has a compartment to stuff the treat. I kept it In the back yard to lay off the smell and use it as a garden decoration.
customer_reviews.author: Amz Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Australian cattle dogs that destroy just about every toy I give them. I am surprised they have not damaged this one in any way and they love it and chew on it all the time. They love it too because it bounces in different directions when thrown so they are not sure where it is going to go. Great toy specially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny L. Cash

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for large dog or aggressive chewer
customer_reviews.text: I think this will work best with a larger dog or an aggressive chewer. My medium size dog finds it bigger than he desires, but he is not an aggressive chewer either. He likes it, just not as much as some other toys. It does have a pleasing aroma to it.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Kathy

customer_reviews.title: New Favorite Toy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how this thing keeps its clean smell. Definitely improves dog breath. The uneven surface and unpredictable bounce action makes it more enjoyable than your standard fetch ball. Using with a large bread so we haven't really been able to get much use out of the treat dispensing feature.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron C.

customer_reviews.title: So far it really is indestructible!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog tears apart every indestructible toy and so far this has lasted several days without him getting any pieces off. The treats are too hard to get out and it almost seems mean to put them in so we don’t do that part. We play fetch with it and leave him alone to chew on and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: tjam

customer_reviews.title: torn up in the first few minutes of getting it in the mail
customer_reviews.text: I got it a few minutes ago. I put a zestypaw allergy treat in there and watched her play with it. tiny light blue pieces of the toy are flaking off already. the base of the toy where treats go in is torn as well. Will not last 10 mins for a 3 month old puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Flanders

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy for Fur Babies!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toy for large dogs! One of my Danes wore herself out playing with it. You can sneak a treat or two in it and it's got bounce so they can play for a long time without getting bored. Very thick, heavy and durable for any breed that needs something to chew on.
customer_reviews.author: Theos.rain

customer_reviews.title: Best all-around toy for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: My 14 mo old Doberman puppy “Ripley” has been loving this extremely durable and well designed chew toy for the past 6 (!) months. To say it’s her favorite is an understatement! She gives it an unqualified four 🐾🐾! ! This is a tough toy for the most aggressive chewers. Your dog will be so happy you made this smart purchase. Mine sure is🙂
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great texture...rubbery smell.
customer_reviews.text: My shepherd/pit mix had a crushed jaw due to an accident and he is banned from "hard" toys and bones. That said, he is a chewer and needs to keep his teeth clean. It is often a struggle to find something that meets both requirements. This does! I just wish the rubber smell would fade soon. He has had it almost a week and it is still pretty strong. But, he absolutely LOVES this thing! If his brother tries to play with it he straight up won't allow it. This is HIS gorilla.
customer_reviews.author: Angie H.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 Siberian husky pups. This thing is super tough...it is heavy as well. The ridges work well for keeping those little teeth clean and they have yet to rip a chunk off of it. I've had it for about a month now I guess and they chew on it every day. Definitely a great find for those mischievous little pups.
customer_reviews.author: Respecka

customer_reviews.title: It stinks!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I left this Amazon box in the garage for a bit due to Covid-19 and I can't return this item. IT STINKS! The smell is so intense that it's all you can smell when you walk in the house, and my dogs refuse to play with it. So it's back in the garage. Good idea, BAD odor!
customer_reviews.author: The Happy Artist

customer_reviews.title: Dog hates it, but hey it’s sturdy 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: Well it’s definitely indestructible, but my dog hates it. Treats go in but they are IMPOSSIBLE to get out. Maybe if they’re tiny? Maybe my dog hates it because it’s so sturdy? Idk, but it’s been completely ignored while he LOVES his other toys. Maybe the smell turns him off???
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great value - long lasting
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a large dog who loves to chew. This is the longest lasting toy he's ever had. He chews on it constantly and it's held up very well - no shards of plastic/rubber have come off. Very durable. Treats go in but don't come out very easily. I worry they might go bad in there but it keeps him entertained. It does have a very specific odor that is strong and I can tell which room the toy is in because the whole room smells like it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

product_meta.title: Arm & Hammer Super Treadz Gator & Gorilla Chew Toy for Dogs | Best Dental Dog Chew Toy | Reduces Plaque & Tartar Buildup Without Brushing
product_meta.description:
The Arm & Hammer Super Treadz Dental Dog Toy helps keep your dog’s teeth clean while he plays. These toys are the ultimate, durable dental toy for your pet. They are specifically designed to help freshen breath, stimulate gums, and reduce tartar and plaque buildup while the extremely durable body withstands even the most aggressive of chewers. These adorable and beneficial toys are sure to keep your pup busy for hours while the baking soda infused rubber body works to gently clean and freshen their teeth. Ingredients: Natural rubber and baking soda. Safety Key Benefits - Designed to help freshen breath, stimulate gums, and reduce tartar and plaque buildup. - Made from extremely durable rubber to withstand even the most aggressive of chewers. - Fun shapes keep your pup enticed and distracted for hours on end. - Easily redirect unwanted chewing into positive playtime. - Baking soda infused for easy dental care, all while your furry friend plays. Warning: As with all chew toys, please supervise use and remove all separated parts. Product is not intended to be eaten or ingested. Please contact your veterinarian or take away. *Satisfaction Guaranteed: Reach out to us directly at info@fetch4pets.com if you are unsatisfied with your purchase.

BRAND_DESCRIPTION
Arm & Hammer
feature_bullets: EXTREMELY DURABLE — This Arm & Hammer Dental Dog Toy is made from extremely durable, all natural rubber to withstand even the most aggressive of chewers. While no dog toy is truly indestructible, this one comes very close
GORILLA SHAPE — This fun gorilla shape will keep your pup enticed and distracted for hours on end
FRESHENS BREATH AND REDUCES TARTAR — Designed to help freshen breath, stimulate gums, and reduce tartar and plaque buildup as your dog plays and chews away
BAKING SODA INFUSED AND DISHWASHER SAFE — Safely fight bad breath with the power of baking soda. Dog toy is also dishwasher safe for easy cleaning
SATISFACTION GUARANTEED* — If you have any questions or feedback, please reach out to us at info@fetch4pets.com

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
